edu.pitt.bank

Class WebBankUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.pitt.bank.WebBankUtilities

  • public class WebBankUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains some advanced bank functions too complex to fit in the regular .JSP. Each of the functions is described in detail under their respective documentation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebBankUtilities() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static java.lang.String accountDetailsToText(Account currentAccount)
      This method creates an HTML text string in which the account details are formatted for display.
      static java.lang.String generateTransactionTable(Account account)
      This method creates an HTML formatted text that generates a table out of all the transactions of an Account.
      static java.lang.String generateUserPermissions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lug, Customer customer)
      This method creates an HTML formatted text listing the contents an ArrayList which contains all of the user's permissions in the system.
      static java.lang.String parseAndDeposit(java.lang.String stringAmount, Account currentAccount)
      This method allows for both parsing of a String that contains a value and depositing said value in the specified account.
      static java.lang.String parseAndWithdraw(java.lang.String stringAmount, Account currentAccount)
      This method allows for both parsing of a String that contains a value and withdrawing said value in the specified account.

    • Method Detail

      • parseAndDeposit

        public static java.lang.String parseAndDeposit(java.lang.String stringAmount,
                                               Account currentAccount)
        This method allows for both parsing of a String that contains a value and depositing said value in the specified account. It returns a String that contains the result of the operation. If the parsing goes well, the method will return a positive message. It also checks account status to process the transaction.
        Parameters:
        stringAmount - - Value to be parsed
        currentAccount - - Account to which the value is going to be deposited
        Returns:
        - Returns a plain text description of the result of the method.

      • parseAndWithdraw

        public static java.lang.String parseAndWithdraw(java.lang.String stringAmount,
                                                Account currentAccount)
        This method allows for both parsing of a String that contains a value and withdrawing said value in the specified account. It returns a String that contains the result of the operation. If the parsing goes well, the method will return a positive message. It also checks account status to process the transaction.
        Parameters:
        stringAmount - - Value to be parsed
        currentAccount - - Account from which the value is going to be withdrawn
        Returns:
        - Returns a plain text description of the result of the method.

      • accountDetailsToText

        public static java.lang.String accountDetailsToText(Account currentAccount)
        This method creates an HTML text string in which the account details are formatted for display. The formatting is the following: Type: Balance: Interest Rate: Penalty: Status:
        Parameters:
        currentAccount - - Account whose details you need formatted
        Returns:
        - The details formatted in HTML

      • setCurrentAccount

        public static Account setCurrentAccount(java.lang.String currentCboSelect,
                                        Bank bank)
        This method looks through the provided bank for a value selected and returns the entire matching account.
        Parameters:
        currentCboSelect - - Account ID of the account you wish to load
        bank - - Bank in which the account is located
        Returns:
        - Account selected!

      • generateUserPermissions

        public static java.lang.String generateUserPermissions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lug,
                                                       Customer customer)
        This method creates an HTML formatted text listing the contents an ArrayList which contains all of the user's permissions in the system.
        Parameters:
        lug - - This is the array list that contains the user permissions
        customer - - This is the user logged into the system
        Returns:
        - An HTML formatter text with the results.

      • generateTransactionTable

        public static java.lang.String generateTransactionTable(Account account)
        This method creates an HTML formatted text that generates a table out of all the transactions of an Account.
        Parameters:
        account - - The account in question
        Returns:
        - The table!
